intro: Cuphea loxensis, commonly known as the red-veined cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces vibrant, showy bracts that often resemble petals, enhancing its ornamental value. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea loxensis is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
